Posted By: garabor (4/28/2011 2:02:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: If you're against an Infect deck, this card is pure gold (she said as though it were not glaringly obvious). Sure, she needs protection from various types of removal, destruction, and direct damage, but so do most good permanents. Of course, unless you're running a deck that also takes advantage of her abilities when you're *not* raging against the tyranny of Phyrexia, you're going to want to leave her in your sideboard.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I love her.
  
It's counter-infect without straight-up removing poison counters, like Wizards promised.
  
I can't really say anything about this card - it's all said on the card, and in present/future comments.
  
Let's face it: she'll see green sideboard.
  
She's cheap, she's useful, and she's flavourfully/functionally beautiful.

Posted By: JFM2796 (8/19/2011 1:52:03 PM)
Rating:

@BastianQoU: No, Melira does prevent the counters from being placed on Etched Monstrosity. I hate quoting rules because I hate sounding like a know-it-all, but this is somewhat important to learn due to Melira's abilities:

121.5. If a spell or ability refers to a counter being “placed” on a permanent, it means putting a counter on that permanent while it’s on the battlefield, or that permanent entering the battlefield with a counter on it.

Somebody get Midnight Banshee on her side, by the way. Those two will do work.

Posted By: spartanvi (10/11/2012 12:57:50 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really wish I could make an EDH deck with her as a general, but sadly, I feel like there are just not enough mono green colored/artifact cards which can profit from her, yet...  
  
Best combo I´ve seen so far with her is to use a sac outlet for the [Woodfall Primus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Woodfall Primus).   
Or the [Witherscale Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Witherscale Wurm) also has a great synergy with her... Still 2 or 3 more other ways to combo with her as a general, but I just feel like it´s not enough...  
  
IMO, this is a great card, but I think, perhaps it rather should have been a green/black card, instead of just a monogreen card. This way, it would have been twice as nice.   
  
Though, I´m not 100% sure yet, but I think, I could see her fit very well, as a "second general", in a [Savra, Queen of the Golgari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Savra, Queen of the Golgari) EDH deck...
posts.html:

Or the Witherscale Wurm also has a great synergy with her... Still 2 or 3 more other ways to combo with her as a general, but I just feel like it´s not enough...

IMO, this is a great card, but I think, perhaps it rather should have been a green/black card, instead of just a monogreen card. This way, it would have been twice as nice.

posts.post_content:
Run with [Phyrexian unlife](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian unlife), throw in some fateful hour while you're at it.  
  
They will not lose the "infect" granted from unlife, but you can't get poison counters. Your life is now stuck at 0 (or slightly below) meaning fateful hour is in effect, but you are still (moderately) safe.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: The funny thing is, this is a great addition to an infect deck. [Ichor Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ichor Rats), [Phyrexian Vatmother](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Vatmother), and especially [Phyrexian Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Hydra) all benefit from it. Plus having it yourself helps protect against opponents trying to use it against you, since it's legendary.

Posted By: UncreativeNameMaker (6/18/2012 4:33:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Best thing you can do with her? [Aether Flash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aether Flash) and any creature with two toughness and persist. It just keeps dying repeatedly and creates an endless loop that ends the game in a draw. Like the old triple-[Faceless Butcher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Faceless Butcher) prank, and a lot easier to pull off.  
  
I mean, I suppose you *could* play [Murderous Redcap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Murderous Redcap) and make an infinite damage loop, but personally, I'd rather make my friends smile (limit one smile per friend; repeated use not recommended).
posts.html:
Best thing you can do with her? Aether Flash and any creature with two toughness and persist. It just keeps dying repeatedly and creates an endless loop that ends the game in a draw. Like the old triple-Faceless Butcher prank, and a lot easier to pull off.

I mean, I suppose you could play Murderous Redcap and make an infinite damage loop, but personally, I'd rather make my friends smile (limit one smile per friend; repeated use not recommended).

posts.post_content:
I don't know who rate Zokorad's comment 0.5/5, but it doesn't make sense because Melira + [Phyrexian Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Hydra) = seven total mana for a 7/7 infect who happens to be very good with [Inquisitor's Flail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inquisitor's Flail).  
  
Ironically, green infect seems to be best with the stopper of infect.  
  
5/5 for this card by itself for ChrisHanson's reasons.  
  
EDIT: @tcollins: Because the -1/-1 counter in Persist's text is in no way involved with a cost or something you HAVE to do, the creature would be returned to play without a counter.
posts.html:
I don't know who rate Zokorad's comment 0.5/5, but it doesn't make sense because Melira + Phyrexian Hydra = seven total mana for a 7/7 infect who happens to be very good with Inquisitor's Flail.

Ironically, green infect seems to be best with the stopper of infect.

5/5 for this card by itself for ChrisHanson's reasons.

EDIT: @tcollins: Because the -1/-1 counter in Persist's text is in no way involved with a cost or something you HAVE to do, the creature would be returned to play without a counter.
